oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grundy County Circuit Court opinion on padlocking at Highlander Folk School
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Opinion in Grundy County Circuit Court case State of Tennessee, ex rel. A. F. Sloan, v. Highlander Folk School, et al. The judge opined that the state's case on immorality was not proven, citing one instance in 17 years. The judge also dismissed the charges of fighting, quarrelling, and drunkenness, but upheld the state's case that Highlander was possessing and selling beer without a permit. The judge felt mercy for Highlander and only ordered the padlocking of the one building in which beer was stored, possessed, and sold, the main Highlander building.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Governmental investigations; Civil rights; Circuit courts; Immorality; Beer; Injunctions
